name: Omegalodon
description: Omegalodon is a third-person multiplayer action game where players compete by attacking/defending the city. The Red Team is comprised of police and soldiers armed with an array of military vehicles and explosive weaponry. The Green Team is comprised of Omegalodon, a 100-foot shark monster, and the Enviros, equipped with a healing beam.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or better Processor: 1.4 gHz Intel or AMD Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 256 MB DirectX compatible DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 300 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Two Teams. One city.   The pixelated destruction involved here has managed to make me tense and carefully maneuver my pixelguy around. Either from one team or another.  One team has a Ginormous Landshark Japanese Thingy that destroys most on its path. Other players on this team are armed with simple pistols and healing beams that activate automatically when 'near' the GLJT. The other team on the other hand has military units that can pound rockets and even what seemed like a mother of all bombs slow targetting ordinance. Both sides die frequently and must respawn and race back towards the location of GLJT either to kill it or heal it. Usually GLJT will die or reach the objective and destroy it.  CRAZY fun! Invite your steam friends to join you for even greater lolz. The only way this game is ever going not to get a recommend is if the community abandons it and it dies. So spread the word!

If only more people played this. With one incredibly detailed map, dotted with multiple vehicles ( the space bomber/ fighter jet/thing being my favourite) and jokes, this game never ceases to be ridiculous. It's not without problems however. As I said there is only one map that is one mile squared in area, which isn't really enough for a MOBA. Movement is also very restricted as the Omegalodon which makes it hard to hit ground enemies before they run away.  Overall, if your willing to overlook the small mapsize and you don't play as the Beast from the deep too often, you will have a whale of a time with this game.

Omegalodon. If you were playing as Omegaladon you'd need atleast 3 Enviros right up your trumpet just for you to survive, That and it takes 13+ Minutes to get to the Objective as the Shark. I feel i was robbed of the $10 i used to purchase the game as it just wasn't as enjoyable of most games like it.  2/10

An awesome little game that is well worth the small amount of money This simplistic game pits two teams against each other (Red and Green) in a race to see who can kill what first  Pros: -Simple and easy to learn -Quite a low price for such a well made game -Hours of fun possible and plenty of silly people to meet -low system Requirements  Cons: -Maybe a little too simple (Only one map and limited Vehicles) -no 'Official' servers, Gameplay relies solely on other players wanting to play -a lot of people are using an out-dated version, preventing 1.6 players to populate certain servers (and same Vice-Versa) -Camera angle can feel restrictive (not enough forward vision)  I rate it 8/10 mainly because it's simple fun and easy to learn but certain flaws in the design prevent it from achieving as high as it could, I feel plane controls could be a bit more responsive and not so loose and swervy, Helicopters seem to dominate the battlefield due to their superior range and manueverability, Ground Vehicles are not nearly powerful enough for sustained combat or Hit and run tactics. To put it simply, If you're decent enough with the Helicopter, You're not gonna die as Soldier/Police unless you make a silly mistake, making it rather unfair on Omegalodon (also, a lot of servers just seem to become a DeathMatch when No one wants to play as Omegalodon)

A charming little indie game that pays homage to classic Kaiju films. One player controls the Titular Omegalodon, and the rest split between helping and hurting him as he makes his way to the Atomic power plant in the center of town. A great game, but make sure you buy it with friends, there aren't too many people playing it.
